title: Crossover: Book Four of the Back to Normal Series
features: It is December. 1956. Christmas isn't the only thing coming to town. The ruthless forces of Project SATURN have finally uncovered the conclusive evidence they require. With Normal, Illinois within the government's crosshairs, time has nearly run out for the struggling band of desperate but hopeful Jumpers. But now that Emile Papineau has been horrifically murdered, can Doc Stonecroft complete the Tesla portal before they are apprehended by the CIA? Will the growing animosity between Denver Collins and Robert Sheppard tear the fragmented and fragile group apart? More gut-wrenching tragedy and a surprising source of help awaits in Crossover, the final installment of Back to Normal Series One.
description: "★★★★★ Bravo!!! Now that is how you write a finale to a book series!""★★★★★ Crossover is undeniably the best book in the Back to Normal series. It transports you into the lives of each character and forces you to feel a range of emotions. As the story unfolds, the suspense is gripping and you will not be able to put it down.""★★★★★ Amazing book overall, and as a series, one of my favorite I've ever read. Back To Normal has kept me hooked for this whole past year...""★★★★★ Crossover is an engrossing read. As the last installment in the Back to Normal series, the breadcrumbs that McWilson meticulously planted throughout the first three books all culminate in surprising and often shocking fashion.""★★★★★ An incredible end to a spectacular book! Twists, turns and 'ah-ha' moments make this one of the best suspense sci fi books I've ever read!""★★★★★ Brilliant wrap-up of an amazing series! Well worth the read, especially when each book in the series is better than the one before. Highly recommended!"

Randy L. McWilson is a science fiction fan and fantasy writer from the very heart of the Heartland of America. A California native, he was transplanted to the Midwest in 1980. McWilson graduated from Southeast Missouri State University, receiving a B.A. Degree in Media in 1991. Over the last decade, he has written across a variety of genres, including feature-length screenplays for a Romantic Comedy, Police Thriller, Action Thriller, and even a Drama-Thriller Television series. His latest works are The Dragon Offering, The Dragon Wrath, and The Dragon Relics, Book One, Two, and Three of a four-part fantasy series centered around a group of special youth known as the Dunamai, whose actions involving the arrival of the Seventh Dragon will change the course and future of the Five Kingdoms. McWilson has also penned the popular Back to Normal quadrilogy. These titles are Book One: Paradigm Rift, Book Two: Tradecraft, Book Three: Proximity, and Book Four: Crossover. This series revolves around a motley crew of involuntary time-jumpers that find themselves mysteriously transported back to post-World War II America, and follows their desperate struggle to find a way back home before the CIA and a KGB assassin can find them. McWilson resides in Jackson, Missouri with his wife, Amanda, 3 children, 5 cats, and his lovable puppy who weighs in just shy of 115 pounds.More information about The Arlon Prophecies, including character images, Dragon artwork, clickable map and book synopses, can be found at: arlonprophecies.com
